decision_conditions: Development  shall  be  carried  out  in  accordance  with  the  materials  specified  on  the approved plans and on the application form unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.Reason: To ensure a satisfactory appearance on completion of the development in accordance with Policy DM10 (Design Requirements for New Developments including House Extensions) of the LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012.
The development hereby permitted shall begin before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.Reason: This is required by Section 91 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990.

Prior to beneficial occupation of the development to which this permission relates, any new windows or rooflights at second floor level or above in the northern and southern flank elevations shall be constructed so that no part of the framework less than 1.7m above finished floor level shall be openable. Any part below that level shall be fitted with and permanently retained in obscure glazing to a minimum of level 3 on the standard scale. Any film used to achieve the requisite obscurity level shall be non-perishable, tamper-proof, and shall be replaced immediately in the event that it ceases to result in obscurity to level 3.Reason: To ensure satisfactory living conditions for neighbouring occupiers, in accordance with policy DM10 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.

Officer ReportApplication SiteThe site comprises a bungalow. The site is not subject to any particular designations or environmental constraints.Proposal Erection of single storey rear extension, roof extension with 2nos side dormers and installation of 8nos side rooflights to facilitate loft conversion.Consultations7 properties were notified of the proposal. One representations has been received objecting to the proposal, with comments summarised as follows:- Excessive height or bulk of building- Inappropriate design/layoutOfficer response: The above comments will be addressed within the report.The key areas of assessment are:- The design of the proposed development; and,- The impact of the development on the amenities of existing and future occupants of land and buildings; and,- Fire SafetyCharacter and AppearanceWhen read together Policies CS8 and DM10 of the Royal Borough of Kingston upon Thames Local Development Framework Core Strategy (CS)(2012) and the guidance in the Royal Borough of Kingston upon Thames Residential Design Guide SPD (2013) require proposals to be of a high quality design that respects the character and appearance of the original building and the prevailing character of the surrounding area. Officer Comment: The proposed single storey rear extension would be approximately 4m deep and would have an eaves height of approximately 2.9m, in accordance with Policy Guidance 33 of the Council's Residential Design SPD. The proposed roof form and materials would match the existing ones.The proposed side dormers would be set back approximately 8m from the front elevation. It is noted that the dormers would  be built in the style of a mansard roof, contrary to Policy Guidance 39. However it is noted that the property benefits from permitted development rights with regards to the roof extensions and the proposal would not exceed the 50 cubic metres allowance. This is considered to be a 'fallback' position in this case which is given significant weight.  Furthermore, Officers note that the existing street scene contains examples of various roof extensions to bungalows and given the siting of the site dormers and its scale, it is considered that there would be no significant impact on the existing street scene as a result of the proposal.Given the above, the proposed development is considered to be acceptable in terms of scale, form, bulk, height, massing, spacing and design. It is considered that there would be no adverse impacts on the character or appearance of the area as a result of the proposed development.Neighbouring AmenitiesPolicy DM10 of the Royal Borough of Kingston upon Thames Local Development Framework Core Strategy (CS)(2012) and the guidance in the Royal Borough of Kingston upon Thames Residential Design Guide SPD (2013) requires proposal to have regard to the amenities of the future occupants of the development as well as those of the existing occupants of neighbouring land and buildings, including in terms of privacy, outlook, sunlight/daylight, avoidance of visual intrusion and noise and disturbance.Officer Comment: It is considered that the proposed development due to its siting, separation distances and scale would not significantly adversely affect the amenities of the occupiers of neighbouring properties by reason of overbearing appearance, loss of light or loss of privacy.Fire SafetyLondon Plan Policy D12(A) requires all development proposals to achieve the highest standards of fire safety, embedding these at the earliest possible stage.The applicant has not submitted a Fire Safety Strategy, however, the plans include the provision of a suitably positioned outside space for fire appliances/ an evacuation assembly point and officers see no reason why a development of the type sought could not comply with the rest of the provisions of Policy D12(A), the details of which could be secured through conditions. For these reasons, officers conclude that the proposal would not conflict with Policy D12 of the London Plan.ConclusionIn conclusion, the proposed development is considered to be  in accordance with the development plan taken as a whole and there are no other material considerations which warrant a decision other than in accordance with the development plan.

On the 1st May 2024 the Council adopted a new Validation Local List. As per the new validation requirements, please complete and submit a Validation Checklist - Section 3. The new Validation  Local List and checklists can be obtained via the council's website: https://www.kingston.gov.uk/downloads/download/261/validation-requirements-for-planning-applicationsThe LPA will not conduct any validation checks until the correct Checklist has been submitted. Upon receipt of a completed Checklist, the application will be assigned to a validation officer to review. Please do not simply state N/A in the checklist without a written justification.If you need to make any changes to your application please try to do this via the Planning Portal website where possible. If that is not possible please send amended documents via the email address quoted in this letter.
